column5: My Merc starter finally gave in on me after 19 years. Now I am faced with the decision of whether to have to buy or rebuild. Anyone have any input on rebuilding as it is a lot cheaper.
I have never rebuilt but what size is the engine? If smaller I would likely just start over with new...bigger? Ya would definitely look into a repair if the engine has been solid otherwise

No experience with an outboard starter, but with a car starter sometimes just the brushes were worn, a few bucks and a little time, easy fix. A rough idea on new prices? https://www.amazon.com/DB-Electrical-SAB0168-50-859377T-50-884044T/dp/B008CQRSN6
Buddy, give these guys a call https://www.goldsealdcelectric.ca/
Definitely depends on how much power you have. also worth considering is how much money on fuel you will save with for example a newer four stroke vs an old two. especially with gas at 1.30+
My buddy had the starter on his 2012 merc 150 rebuilt and as far as I know it turned out fine.
I bought rebuilt starter for my 225 Merc $500 years ago worked great. Call a few referb places see if available.
